Author: Rodrigo Zechin Rosauro 
http://droidwall.googlecode.com 
 
Droid Wall - Android Firewall is a front-end application for the powerful iptables Linux firewall. It allows you to restrict which applications are permitted to access your data networks. 
This is the perfect solution if you don't have an unlimited data plan, or just wants to see your battery lasting longer. 
Using Droid Wall: 
1. Click on Network Interfaces to select which interfaces should be blocked. 
2. Click on Mode to switch between White List and Black List modes. 
3. Mark the applications that you want to block or allow (depending on the selected mode). 
4. Open the menu and click on Apply rules to modify your iptables rules. 
Note: After applying the rules, they will be saved and automatically restored every-time you restart your phone. 
 
Other features: 
Click on Show rules menu to display current iptables rules output. 
 
Click on Disable Firewall menu to completely disable the Firewall. You must manually enable the Firewall later by clicking on Enable Firewall. 
 
Password lock: 
You can set a password lock for Droid Wall by using the Set password menu option. To remove the password protection, just reset it to blank.
